greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes between 2n and 4n.
link: T. D. Noe and Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := PrimePi[4n] - PrimePi[2n]; Table[ f[n], {n, 76}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 10 2005 *)
program: (PARI) bet2n4n(n) = { local(c,x,y); forstep(x=2,n,2, c=0; forprime(y=x+1,x+x-1, c++; ); print1(c",") ) }
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Jan 28 2005
